Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Are you listening to me Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Affirmative.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What did I just say?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You just said, let me uh... check my notes. You just said...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Alan and I have created an incentive program to increase sales.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey how is Alan? Tell Alan that the Mets suck! Okay? From me, big time. Go Pirates!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm not going to do that Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We've created an incentive program to increase sales.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: At the end of the month you can reward your top seller with a prize worth up to a thousand dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa. Howdy-ho. Wow, a thousand big ones. That's cool. Do I uh, do I get to pick the prize?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, yes. Yes you can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, question: Does top salesman include uh, people who were at one time such outstanding salesman that've been promoted to...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, Michael. No. You can't win this prize.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't mean me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, first what we have to do is find out what motivates people more than anything else.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sex.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's illegal. Can't do that. Next best thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Torture.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tah, come on Dwight. Just help me out here. That's just stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, there's a...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Burger with cheese!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's a person here...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And fries!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And shake! What? Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's a person here who wants to sell handbags.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. No vendors in the office. That is a distraction.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, I told her you'd talk to her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam. Pam. Come on, I'm busy. So just tell her to go away.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [exhales loudly, looks out window and sees Katy] Oooh, alright I'll talk to her.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: This one is hand embroidered.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right girls break it up, you're being infiltrated. Cock in the henhouse.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cocks in the henhouse.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't say cocks. Oh, what is your name, my fair lass?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Katy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, Katy. Wow. Look at you. You are, uh you're like the new and improved Pam. Pam 6.0.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Pam looks embarassed at Michael - Katy looks sympathetically at Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, look. Oh hey, no catfights you two. I'm against violence in the workplace.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So am I.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody cares what you think.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So uh, you know what? I usually don't allow solicitors in the office but today I am going to break some rules, and you can have the conference room. It's yours. All day.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Wow, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's an HR meeting in there at 11:30.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, lets put 'em in the hallway. Give 'em some chairs. Right? Decisiveness. One of the keys to success according to Small Businessman.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do. I read Small Business man. I also uh, subscribe to USA Today and American Way Magazine, that's the in-flight magazine. Some great articles in that. They did this great profile last month of Doris Roberts and where she likes to eat when she's in Phoenix. Illuminating.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is my conference room. So please, uh, make yourself at home. Whatever you need, I'm right on the other side of this wall. [knocks on wall] used to be a window here. There's not anymore. So, that's where I will be.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Katy unpacks her handbags]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So if you need anything else, something to make you more confortable just don't hesitate to ask. I'm right here.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I guess a cup of coffee would be great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait a second. I should have spotted another addict. Uh, gotta love the 'bucks.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's like a slang for Starbucks. They're all over the place. Oh, man, that place is like the promised land to me. What a business model too. Ah, too bad we don't have the good stuff here.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Regular coffee is fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nah, it's not. it's spppplllibbb

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: No really it is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, here's the thing. Y'know I do my best to be my own man and go by the beat of a different drummer and nobody gets me, and they're always putting up walls and I'm always tearing 'em down, just breakin' down barriers, that's what I do all day. So a coffee, regular coffee for you. High test, or unleaded?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Bring it on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Woo, I will. I will bring it on. Ah, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So are you jealous 'cause there's another girl around?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She's prettier than you though.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a very rude thing to say, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: So do you like the periwinkle and the purples?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The purse girl hits everything on my checklist. Creamy skin. Straight teeth. Curly hair. Amazing breasts. Not for me, for my children. The Schrutes produce very thirsty babies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [handing Katy a mug of coffee] There ya go. Nice steaming cup o'joe.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have an idea. Why don't I introduce you around, you know you can kind of get your foot in the door, meet potential clientele, right?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Gosh, I would love to but, my purses, I should, um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, um, well, we could have Ryan take a look. Ryan, would you look after the purses, please?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm installing File Share on all the computers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, bladdy-bluda-blah-blah. Techno-babble. Just do it, okay. We have company. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You should sell a lot here because this branch made over a million dollars last year. Not that we're all millionaires. I'm probably closest. So here's Oscar. Oscar, this is Katy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oooh-ooh. Oscar the grouch. Right? I thought of that.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: That was on Sesame Street.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I know. I made the connection. Can you believe he'd never heard that before he worked here?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: No, I don't believe that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, it's unbelievable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's nice having Katy around. It's another person for Michael to um, interact with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here is Toby from Human Resources. Katy, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Hi

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby, Katy.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, um did you go to uh, Bishop O'Hara?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Cool. What year were you there?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Eighty-nine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby's divorced. He uh, guh recently, right?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You and your wife, and you have kids.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: A girl.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh that so - that was really messy. He slept one night in your car too?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [looks resigned]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I should probably get back to my table.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Alright. Cool. See ya in a bit. [looks at picture on Toby's desk] Oh, she's cute. Cutie-pie. Back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I live by one rule. No office romances. No way. Very messy. Inappropriate. No. But, I live by another rule: Just do it. Nike.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, Jimmy what do you think of that little purse girl, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cute, sure, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Why don't you get on that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's not really my type.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What are you gay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmmm, I don't think so. Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What is your type?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [glances at Pam] Moms, primarily. Yep. Soccer moms. Single moms. NASCAR moms. Any type of moms, really.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: That's disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Stay away from my mom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Too late, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [Katy walks through breakroom] Man, I would be all over that if I wasn't dating Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're not dating, we're engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Engaged, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam and I are good buddies. I'm sort of Pam's go-to guy for her problems. You know with stuff like work, or uh, her fiance Roy. Or uh... Nope, those are pretty much her only two problems.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She'd be perfect for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmmm... she's been talking to Michael a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, what? You're Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you know what Dwight? He's your work boss, okay? He is not your relationship boss.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's true.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Plus you have so much more to talk to this girl about, You're both um, salesmen. I mean that's something right there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: True. Plus I can talk to her about the origins of my last name.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's all gold.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Guys are usually my best customers, they buy the high end stuff like the beads and the sequins and stuff. For gifts, you know? They don't know what they are looking at. So I make suggestions.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Here's the thing okay, you just keep talking to her. If you hit a stall you have a perfect fall back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You buy a purse.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't want a purse. Purses are for girls.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, that's not necessarily true. Do you read GQ?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I do. There like mini briefcases, alright? Lots of guys have them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like those?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. Listen, you are spending way too much time talking to me, when you could be talking to her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm just going to use the bathroom, and then I'm going...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. You don't need the bathroom. You've got it. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, shhhh stop... stop whatever you're doing because this is going to be good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [mimicing Dwight in high-falsetto voice] Hi my name's Dwight Schrute and I would like to buy a purse from you. Good lord, look at these purses! This is something special. Oh my God is this Salvatore Di-chini-asta?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [mimicing Katy] Oh definitely, definitely step in and out of it like that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, well I want to stress test it. You know, in case anything happens.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! That was really. [Dwight hits purse against table] This is necessary to do to really give it a good workout. This is the ooooh... This is the prettiest one of all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm going to be the prettiest girl in the ball. Oh, how much?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, God. It's sad. It's so sad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispering] Here he comes, shhh...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [gives Dwight a thumbs-up - mouths the word] Good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiles in agreement]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He did pick a good one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're horrible.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: This one's really good for a hot date.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, what's that?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm engaged. So...

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Congratulations. You need a hot date more than anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I wished, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Giggle-giggle, juji-juji, I get it, I get it. Divine Secrets of the Ya Ya Sisterhood over here right? [to Katy] So how's that uh, coffee from earlier?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, I knew it. Guzzled it down. You greedy little thing. So, uh, Pam is this your lunch break, or was that earlier when you were eating in the kitchen with those guys?

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Pam sheepishly hands Katy the purse and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: [whispers] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Busted.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Come back...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh hey, I want to show you something. Come here I want to show you something. I know you are going to like this. Picked it up today. A thousand big ones.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Is that from Starbucks?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. This is a Starbucks digital barista. This is the mack daddy of espresso makers.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Wow. Is that for the office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I know what you're thinking. You're not prying this out of my hands, but don't tempt me because I'll give it to you!

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I wouldn't think of it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Coffee is the great incentivizer in the office. It's a drug. It is quite literally a drug that speeds people up. It's not the only drug that speeds people up. You hear stories about Dunder Mifflin in the eighties before everybody knew how bad cocaine was. Guh. Man, did they move paper!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Katy reading text message on her phone] Oh the rotating um, steam wand. [Katy looks annoyed] What? What's the matter?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing. My ride just bailed on me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, oh! God. I'm sorry. Is there...?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Oh no, it's um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where you going? Nearby? Because I can give you a ride.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: No...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Seriously. No, really.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: No. I really don't want to inconvenience you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God! No, no, no, no. No inconvenience. I mean I'm out of here at five sharp.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: At five?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can go earlier. 'Cause I'm the boss. You know, whatever. I'm out of here slaves.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay, I guess that would be, I guess that would be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Sounds good. Sounds good. Five o'clock sharp. I will give you and your purses a ride home.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay. Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great. Cool. Cool. [takes deep breath - looks at camera] Yeah, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I should have never let the Temp touch this thing. I had all these great icons and now I have four folders. So..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's actually better this way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it's not. Because I could just click on the icon and then I'm onto--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael could I ask you something? I wanted to ask your permission to ask out Katy. I know it's against the rules and everything. Because...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no it's not against the rules. She's not a permanent employee so it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Michael. I appreciate this so much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But I think you should just know that I am going to be giving her a ride home later.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She asked me for a ride and so I am going to give her a ride home.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that all it is? Just a ride home? Like a taxicab?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, might be a ride home. Might be a ride home and we stop for coffee and dot-dot-dot...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please. Please, I am your inferior and I'm asking you this favor. Can you promise me that it will just be a ride home?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I cannot promise you that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You cannot promise me, or you won't promise me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you love her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] Dwight, no. I don't know. It's too early to tell. I don't know how I feel. [Dwight sadly looks away]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I think you've made a really good choice, she's really going to like that.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Espresso?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome. Thank you. Hmmm-hmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is that from the machine that was in your office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ummm-hmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I thought that was the incentive prize for the top salesperson.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very easy to clean.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Stanley walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Like he's going to win anyway, right? [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did we get any mail?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I gave it to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you did. Yes, you did. Just checkin'. Just checkin', double checkin', checkin' on the check. Thoroughness is very important in an office and...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, can I..? [points to the door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, of course. Uh, Pam, one more thing. Um, how do girls your age feel about futons?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A futon?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's a grown man

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's what he said.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's sad. Or it's innovative. Well, you know the futon is a bed and couch all rolled into one. [Jim sees Roy and trails off]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [not looking at Roy] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Are you still mad at me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy...

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Come on [begins to tickle Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cut it out.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Come on, you mad at me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop it. [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Are you still mad at me now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [giggling] Cut it out.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Are you mad at me now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop. [giggling]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Huh? huh? Come on... Come on, Pammy I was just kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [breathless] Stop, I can't breathe.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I was just kidding. You know I didn't mean it. I can't...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim is a great guy. He's like a brother to me. We're like best friends in the office and I really hope he finds someone.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: You seem to like to touch things. Did you try the velvet?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't like to necessarily touch things. I'm just... I'm shopping.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Oh no, it's fine that you, um. Here, what about the raspberry one? It's really uh, kind of festive. It's got a lot of personality.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, uh no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, how's it going? Good. Can I talk to you for a second? In private?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I don't think so I'm really busy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It will just take a second.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just for a minute.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I really can't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please? I wanted to talk to you in private because I wanted to ask you out on a date.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok was that no to talking to me in private, or was that no to the date?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Both.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Dejected, Dwight walks out slowly]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: What colors do you like?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Gray. Dark Gray. Charcoal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you like to help me with a special project?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I would love to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in Michael's car] Okay, just throw out all the empties.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You don't want to recycle them?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, yes. Throw them away in the recycling bin.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Do you want this? [holding a full bottle of water]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What about this bottle of power drink?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, what flavor?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Blue.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Blue's not a flavor.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It says flavor: Blue Blast.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Blue Blast. Yes, put that in the trunk, and there should be an unopened Arctic Chill back there. I want that in the passengers cupholder. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm Jim, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I'm Katy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi Katy, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: You sit out there, don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I do. That's what I'm best known for. Sitting out there. Alright, let's talk about purses.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay, um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Katy but you know what, don't try to sell me one. Okay, seriously 'cause I'm just here to learn.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so I know about most of these, but you know you can...

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What, stop! Whoa! That's my Drakkar Noir.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, this is Rite Aid Night Swept.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it is a perfect smell-alike. I'm not paying for the label. Right here. Give it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, it's empty.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not it's not, there's some in the straw. [Michael opens bottle and wipes straw along his neck] There, now you may throw it out.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wow. How many filet-o-fishes did you eat?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's over several months, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [Under his breath] Still.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm bored.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you for choosing me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I'm kidding. Um, so you got big plans this weekend?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, well I think I'm gonna see Katy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you guys going to do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, man I don't know. Uh, dinner, drinks, movie, matching tattoos.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And stuff... yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I, I was gonna say, I think that um, we're gonna help Roy's cousin move.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 'Cause Roy's got a truck.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, huh. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is cool. Well, I'll see you Monday though, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm gonna head back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think in order to be a ladies man, it's imperative that people don't know you're a ladies man, so I kind of play that close to the chest. I don't know, what can I say? Women are attracted to power. And I think other people have told me that I have a very symmetrical face. [laughs] I don't know. I don't know. Maybe they're right? I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure you don't want me to help you with that? Cause I can grab that no problem.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Goodnight, it was nice to meet some of you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See you later. Goodnight. Goodnight, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Goodnight, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where you going?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. Grab a drink, I think?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: With us?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I uh, I probably should have told you, I don't need a ride now 'cause Jim can take me home after so you're off the hook.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Great. Off the hook. Excellent. Okay, cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I got this. [taking Katy's bag from Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, have fun.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't drink and drive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Take it easy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Have a good night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You too, have a good night.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: You got that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. You sold a lot, so it's lighter.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Good. Here. Squeeze it inside.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright now, I'm gonna warn you. Don't freak out, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is a really nice car. In case you haven't noticed, this is a Corolla. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: It's a... it's a very nice car.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not going to freak out?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I have a special someone? Uh well, yeah of course. A bunch of 'em. My employees. If I had to choose between a one-night-stand with some stupid cow I pick-up in a bar, and these people? I'd pick them every time. Because with them, it is an everyday stand and I still know their names in the morning.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The perfect girl for me would be Konikotaka. She has the most amazing story. She was orphaned at age 10 when both her parents were assassinated, and she was taken in by a wealthy, but very cruel, businessman. So she practiced aikido in secret for years until she could avenge the death of her parents. She's also a survivor of monster rape.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is really well made. Good stitching. Excellent fabric. [shakes the purse from side to side by it's handle] You sell a lot of these?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: It's very popular, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I knew it. Is it waterproof?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I'm not sure. It's faux snakeskin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Snakes are waterproof. So, I'm betting that it's waterproof. Do you know the difference between a snake and an eel?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: 'Cause I could look it up real easily.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: You're really into reptiles, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My belt's made out of alligator. Check it out. [lifts shirt]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Oh, um, it's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight. Dwight. Dwight! Okay, that's it. Keep it in your pants.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was just showing her my belt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, don't do that. Where are your glasses?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He wears glasses. Did you know that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, now suddenly he can see. [laughs] Okay, take off. See ya. Bye-bye. [gives coffee to Katy] There you go steaming hot cup of joe.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I know your hero. Yeah, saving you from Animal Planet Jack over there. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Ha. Yeah, asks a lot of questions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah he is the worst.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's the um, saying, "once their laughing they're... that's... Once they're laughing that's 50 percent of them being horizontal. So, not that I'm just... Not that that's my... that's what I'm trying to do, but I think it helps kind of melts the ice. Breaks the ice, melts... Breaks the ice and melts them. Melts their hearts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Al Gore... for the Internet. Can send messages from one side the global to the other in the blink of an eye. Can you believe we couldn't do that ten years ago?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: We could do that ten years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right, but 20 years ago we couldn't and that is amazing. Here's Toby from Human Resources. This is Katy. Toby, Katy.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, did you go to Bishop Ohara?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Cool, what year where you there?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking over Toby and Katy] Toby's divorced. God, that's hard. That really ripped you up. She got the kids right? That'll damage ya. Sorry man. That's uh, that's a bad one. How much you paying her? What can, you can't even afford anything now, right? You're all right though, right? Don't ask me for a raise. [laughs] Cup of Soup's a good idea though. That'll... that's a good budgetary thing to do.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's just a snack.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, they're good snacks. They're good food, good meals, good lunch. Roman noodles are good too. You still sleepin' in the car?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 'Cause he slept in the car a couple times.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Just the once.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you still taking the antidepressants? 'Cause it was a good idea. 'Cause it'll help. It'll help, man.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go back to my table.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. I'll see you in a bit. [whispering] She's pretty cute isn't she? See you in a bit.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I mean whatever one you want.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, I like that one I think. [Ryan hands her a purse]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean, it looks real good, probably.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know Michael's been talking to her too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you think his chances are?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, Pam I'm not gonna lie to you, he's chances are none. Um, he's 41 years old, he is losing his hair and his cell phone ring is "Mambo #5." So...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] I like that song.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know though. I mean, you know that was a hit.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] 10 years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, was it 10? Yeah, I have it on a mix tape from junior high.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Went well?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think it did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what, just in case she's looking you should put some stuff in it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Anything. [Dwight begins to fill his new purse] Good. Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What else?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Post-it Notes. Wow, that purse holds a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a mini-briefcase.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, oh, I know. Looks great. [Dwight throws the purse over his right shoulder and gets back to work]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you like Steve Miller?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: 'Cause I'm in a Steve Miller Tribute... Tribute Band.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. I need your stapler.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's in my purse.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, great thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me describe the perfect date. I take her out to a nice dinner. She looks amazing. Some guy tries to hit on her. Uh, now he wants to fight. So I grab him. I throw him into a jukebox. Then the other ninja's got a knife. He comes at me. We grapple. I turn his knife on him. Blood on the dance floor. She's scared now, I take her home. I'm holding her in my arms. I reach in for a kiss. I hear something in the leaves. I flip her around. She gets a poison arrow right in her back. She was in on it the whole time. But, I knew.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. That's looking good. Hey um, Ryan do you have any music I can borrow.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What kind do you like?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, I know, everything really. I love it all. I love music.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, do you like hip-hop? Do you like indie rock?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I love both of those so much. A lot of 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay. Do you like The Strokes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm hmm. I like 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Do you like The Hives?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. God. They're awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You like the Fleebulls, The Glorps?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh. Yup. That last thing they did was great.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I had a feeling you would like those.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool, so maybe hook me up with some Fleebulls and some Hive.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. This is gonna be good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi, here you can have this. [Dwight gives Kelly his purse] It's a mini-briefcase, but you can use it as a purse.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Uh, thank you.
